info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 5:24PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN MONROE...CENTRAL BELMONT...OHIO AND MARSHALL COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM EDT... At 524 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Powhatan Point, or 11 miles west of Moundsville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Wheeling, Moundsville, St. Clairsville, Bellaire, Bethlehem, Shadyside, McMechen, Powhatan Point, Glen Dale, Bridgeport, Benwood, and Brookside. This includes Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 214 and 225. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
